ygData.subject: Re: (no subject)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail Bristlebane players! I d like to add something to the Bristlebane community, so here s what I ve learnt about skills. Your skill cap is 5 + 5 x current
ygData.messageBody:
Hail Bristlebane players!

I'd like to add something to the Bristlebane community, so here's what I've
learnt about skills.

Your skill cap is 5 + 5 x current level. So, a level 1 character has a skill
cap of 10 in each of his skills, and a level 10 character has a skill cap of
55. You raise your skills by using them (once you have attained the basics),
so yes, they wil go up if you practice/use them until you reach your level
cap.

Sneak is a tricky skill. Every time you use it you will turn invisible in
your external view and you will walk real slow but this does not mean that
it is working. I have heard that the only way to tell if sneak has worked is
to ask another NPC if you dissapeared from their view. I think the same is
true for the hide skill.

Armistar, Ranger of Tunare

-----Original Message-----
From: TRAVISL <TRAVIS@...>
To: 'bristlebane_eq@onelist.com' <bristlebane_eq@onelist.com>
Date: 12 April 1999 21:51
Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] (no subject)


Do these skills ever go "up" at all?

I mean, they are not listed in the skill list to "put points into" and I've
never seen the skill increase through usage.

I have built a Halfling Druid, who has these abilities. Am I to expect that
these abilities will work just as well now as they will when I attain level
20?

Also, has anyone noticed that sometimes the "Sneak" skill just doesn't
work? You hit Sneak and you continue to walk/run at normal speed? Then it
becomes available to use it again and you try again etc. Sooner or later it
"works."

To top it off, how do you know if it's "really" working?

I've had aggressive monsters run right past me while I was sneaking, only to
have them see me on other occasions. Same monsters.

These are very interesting skills, but I need to know how they really work!

Thanks,
Travis
travis@... <mailto:travis@...>
